equipped.name: (a wooden holy symbol on a cord)

contains.name: (a wooden holy symbol on a cord)

mobs.long_desc: A bronze skinned creature stares at you with fiery eyes.
mobs.desc: This massive metal form looks like a cross between a lion and a bull. It stays stock still unless provoked, but its eyes, glowing golden, move from time to time to survey its surroundings.

mobs.long_desc: Wisps of air gust past you.
mobs.desc: The wisps of air gust around, making a miniature tornado of pale foggy mist that sort of stick together more than one would expect. Some pale blue glowing spots look out almost like eyes, turning this way and that almost as if it wants to see things.

mobs.long_desc: A demonic form shrouded in smoke whistles past as it flies.
mobs.desc: A column of dark, greasy smoke hovers in the air. It doesn't appear to be caused by anything, but to exist solely on its own power. It has no eyes or distinguishable body parts. It envelopes its victims with a sighing noise.

mobs.long_desc: A mage with frizzy hair and crazed eyes stands here.
mobs.desc: This is upon one of the few living inhabitants of the town of Templace.  He looks like he hasn't seen anyone for a long time.  His years of isolation have deterred his sense of good and bad.  With the power of magic at his fingers, he could be a very powerful adversary.

mobs.long_desc: A ghastly creature made of gadgets and parts stares at empty space here.
mobs.desc: This huge beast is made out of gears and metal parts. It looks vaguely dragon-like, but is a mishmash of all sorts of different kinds of metal, from dull, greenish bronze to steel. When it moves, an odd hydraulic noise issues from its wirebound belly at each step of the massive feet, and its head swings ponderously on a long neck, revealing teeth made out of long metal spikes.

mobs.keywords: demon blood-demon blood female succubus red skinned shape
mobs.long_desc: A red-skinned female shape hovers here.
mobs.desc: She's beautiful, but her skin is a very unnatural scarlet color; moreoever, it glows red.  Her long black hair tumbles down her back, past her large bat wings.  She is naked, and her body is one that would inspire artists and lovers for generations, but her slanted amber eyes reveal malevolent intent, and her fanged teeth are bared back whenever she grins or snarls.  Her hands end in long talon-like fingers.

mobs.long_desc: A woman with large snakes curling on her head is screaming here.
mobs.desc: A hideous creature stands here with writhing serpents for hair.  She has two tusk-like protrusions curving out of her face, and a large, red tongue that lolls from her mouth.  Her fists seem to be made from bronze and a pair of golden wings flap on her back.  As you peer at Medusa, her eyes meet with yours, and your joints begin to stiffen.  You are slowly being turned to STONE! You quickly avert your eyes and you begin to feel limber again.

mobs.long_desc: A pillar of earth rips free of the ground, forming a demonic shape.
mobs.desc: It is a large pillar of earth with a barely humanoid upper torso.  Huge horns protrude from its head, and it has vaguely human features.  The grin habitually worn by the monstrous face is difficult to miss.  Arms made of rippling earth end in claws that look sharper than obsidian, and though it has no legs, it moves with a noisy undulation.

mobs.long_desc: A huge grey snake slithers toward you.
mobs.desc: This large, round-bodied snake has a hard grey scaley skin.  Its eyes are small and covered with a whitish membrane, but its long, forked tongue flickers every so often to taste the air.  It moves sinuously, with a strange kind of grace.

mobs.long_desc: One of the lizard's heads stretches forth and lunges at you!
mobs.desc: This appears to be one of the many heads on the Hydra.  Its scaly face and lizard tongue makes you cringe in fear.  It appears that they can only bite you, but appearances can be deceiving.

mobs.long_desc: A nasty, giant mutated dragon glares at you through its 9 heads.
mobs.desc: As you peer at this creature, you are filled with a tingle of dragon fear. Its seven heads look like they could be quite dangerous, perhaps able to breathe fire!  She is pretty large and seems like she would intimidate the weak of heart.

mobs.long_desc: A knight from the tapestries jumps out and lunges at you!
mobs.desc: This heroic knight resembles those you saw in the paintings and tapestries. He looks brave and incredibly strong.  However, as the knights in the tapestries fought for honor and good, this knight is quite the opposite.

mobs.long_desc: Sagece of Raymif glares at you contemptuously.
mobs.desc: Sagece of Raymif is truly a remarkable creature, dominating the entire room with her large girth.  She is almost certainly a match for anyone who would dare to attack her, and has an air of death about her.  Sagece's temper is as vile and black as her scales.

mobs.long_desc: A dark-elf stands here, grinning at you through her cowl.
mobs.desc: There appears to be a sudden chill in the room, but it is actually this transparent elf.  Her darkly colored skin is marked with many strange symbols. Her pointed ears constantly adjust position hearing all sounds to be heard, and her eyes glow green and are fixed in her returning gaze.

mobs.keywords: ironworker worker smith blacksmith ghostly old
mobs.long_desc: An old ironworker looks up from his hearth at you.
mobs.desc: His body is worm-eaten, and an odd bluish pallor tints his skin.  He moves with mindless determination, each footstep making a creaking noise.  If he isn't disturbed, he ignores anybody around him.

mobs.long_desc: A quiet ghost kneels amidst the wreckage, keening.
mobs.desc: She is nearly transparent, with dusty outlines and greyish features.  Her long, wispy hair swirls in nonexistent wind, and her hands, unlike the rest of her shadowy form, are perfectly visible as she sifts through wreckage.  Sometimes she stops and raises her head to keen loudly.

mobs.long_desc: A dark figure is here, cloaked in shadows.
mobs.desc: This muscular elf is almost completely hidden by the shadows here.  He is dressed in black from head to toe.  He has some ability to move with complete silence.  His green eyes glow brightly, then mysteriously fade to blackness.

mobs.long_desc: A towering rock demon is busy tearing gouges in the walls.
mobs.desc: The demon has a male form, with red-brown skin and huge black horns protruding from his temples.  His broad shoulders and muscular chest ripple with suppressed agitation, and when he snarls, he reveals pure white fangs.  Every stomp of his cloven-hoofed feet makes the ground shake.

mobs.long_desc: A tree burning in perpetual agony sways here.
mobs.desc: This tree is in constant pain and has suffered worst of any other living being in Templace.  When the city was destroyed, this tree caught fire, and still to this day burns.  Much of it is blackened, though some of his bark is unburned.

mobs.long_desc: A semi-translucent demon fades light dark shades here.
mobs.desc: This spirit demon is a fairly large creature.  He is the demonic form of a ghost, looking strangely twisted and bent.  What could be called appendages are long and gangly, sharp on the end.  The demon is partially gray with whisps of orange and light red coloring.

objects.ground: A shattered fountain lies in shambles here.

extras.text: This once beautiful fountain is now completely ruined.  At one time it was lovely, but now it is shattered and no longer filled with clear water, but rather with warm, almost boiling, blood.

objects.ground: A ring with golden elven leaves lies here.

extras.text: The golden elven leaves sparkle without reflecting any light.  The glinting appearance comes from the ring itself, and would probably serve to warm the finger it is worn on.

objects.ground: A torch with strange markings floats here.

extras.text: The torch of Sagece has some interesting, peculiar designs carved into it.  It is long, nearly a meter from tip to tip, and carved of a hollow, dark wood.

objects.ground: A pair of black gloves lies here.

extras.text: These gloves are jet black, nearly dark as the night sky with no moon.  There are even small twinkles like the stars.

objects.ground: A dusty, cracked, old wand sits here.

extras.text: This is a wonderful, magical wand, capable of acts beyond normal imagination. It is about two feet long, with a small dragon head at the top.

objects.ground: A chest intricately carved with royal designs floats here.

extras.text: This simple wooden box has been re-fortified time and again.  It is now thicker, having been painted over and encased in hardened iron latches.

objects.ground: Some white-lined boots float here.

extras.text: They look like normal grey leather boots, and are lined in white silk.  But they glow faintly, which most boots don't do.

objects.ground: A pair of heavy gauntlets leaves its imprint on the floor here.

extras.text: They're made of heavy bronze with steel plating, and buckle around the forearm. Each one covers the forearm from elbow to knuckles.

objects.ground: A pair of leather laced boots has been dropped here.

extras.text: These boots are fairly simple, nicely designed with high quality and precision, and laced in the center.

objects.ground: A semi-transparent cloak has been forsaken here.

extras.text: This cloak is long, likely to drape to the ground on nearly anyone.  It is a deep shade of green, with some light frills of purple on the edges.

objects.short: a wooden holy symbol on a cord
objects.ground: A cross made of wood and leather lies here.

extras.text: It is a well-carved symbol in the shape of a sun with a narrow cloth draped around it.  The detail is superb, even if the symbol is no larger than a child's fist.  It hangs from a black silk cord.

objects.ground: A black key lies on the ground here.

extras.text: This key is short and stubby, and oddly shaped.  It must only fit one lock, for there would not be many designed even remotely close to this design or size.

objects.ground: A transparent key lies here.

extras.text: This key is nearly impossible to see, and seems to have a magical quality keeping it that way.

objects.ground: A large gold plated key sits on its top here.

extras.text: At first appearance this key seems to be pure gold, however there are some slight scratches in it, revealing the wrought-iron beneath, making it practically worthless.

objects.ground: A claw with green goo dripping from its tips is here.

extras.text: There seems to be an unending supply of greenish goo emanating from the tip of this claw.  Some of it has dried on the red hilt, leaving an oddly mixed color.

objects.ground: An illustrious sword from olden times is forsaken here.

extras.text: This is a quite heavy broad-bladed sword.  The handle is wrapped in a bit of old rug, with softened leather wrapping around it holding it down.  The nob looks like an upside down crown, capping the end and holding the tapestry securely.

objects.ground: A set of scaled dragon armor lies here, apparently forgotten by the gods.

extras.text: Of all things, dragon skin is incredibly rare.  The scales are hard and a dark black color.  Each scale is the size of man's kneecap, connected from underneath solidly.

objects.ground: A shield made of dragon skin and tempered with dragon fire is here.

extras.text: This shield is huge.  There are large, black dragon claws curving out from the top and bottom towards the outside.  There is a grey symbol surrounded by the coal color of the shield.

objects.ground: A ring with golden elven leaves lies here.

extras.text: The golden elven leaves sparkle without reflecting any light.  The glinting appearance is somewhat perverted, but comes from the ring itself and would probably heat the finger it is worn on.

objects.ground: A torch with strange markings floats here.

extras.text: The torch of Sagece has some interesting, peculiar designs carved into it.  It is long, nearly a meter from tip to tip, carved of a hollow, perverse wood.

objects.ground: A pair of black gloves lies here.

extras.text: These gloves are jet black, nearly as dark as the night sky with no moon.  It looks as though there were once small, star-like twinkles, but those are gone now.

objects.ground: A dusty, cracked, old wand sits here.

extras.text: This is a wonderful, magical wand, capable of acts beyond normal imagination. It is about two feet long, with a small, broken dragon head at the top.

objects.ground: A set of scaled dragon armor lies here, apparently forgotten by the gods.

extras.text: Of all things, dragon skin is incredibly rare.  The scales are hard and a dark black color.  Each scale is the size of a man's kneecap, connected mysteriously beneath.

objects.ground: A shield made of dragon skin and tempered with dragon fire is here.

extras.text: This shield is huge.  There are large, cracked dragon claws curving out form the top and bottom towards the outside.  There is a half-covered grey symbol surrounded by the coal color of the shield.

objects.ground: A pair of leather laced boots has been dropped here.

extras.text: These boots are fairly simple, nicely designed with high quality and precision. The laces down the center are blackened, not matching the rest of the boot.

objects.short: a wooden holy symbol on a cord
objects.ground: A cross made of wood and leather lies here.

extras.text: It is a crudely carved holy symbol shaped like a spiral, on a black silk cord.

objects.ground: A semi-transparent cloak has been forsaken here.

extras.text: This cloak is long, likely to drape to the ground on nearly anyone.  It is a deep shade of green, with some ugly purple frills on the edges.

objects.ground: A pair of boots with white lining floats here.

extras.text: They look like normal grey leather boots, and are lined with white silk.  They do not shimmer, which is just like most boots.

objects.ground: A pair of heavy gauntlets leaves its imprint on the floor here.

extras.text: They're made of heavy bronze with steel plating, and buckle around the forearm. Each one covers the forearm from elbow to knuckles with a small opening in the middle.

objects.ground: A claw with green goo dripping from its tips is here.

extras.text: There seems to be an unending supply of green goo coming from the tip of this claw.  It is wet all over, refusing to dry.

objects.ground: An illustrious sword from olden times is forsaken here.

extras.text: This is a quite heavy, broad-bladed sword.  The handle is wrapped in a caked, old bit of tapestry and is starting to tear.  The crown on the bottom is dented and smashed.

objects.ground: A steel-bladed dagger with a faceted emerald hilt lies here, gleaming.

extras.text: This dagger has a gleaming steel blade, but its most outstanding feature is surely its faceted emerald hilt.  The quillions are elegantly tapered and curve upward toward the blade, and the shiny gold of them and the pommel contrasts with the green fire of the hilt.  It is wrapped in gold wire for a better grip.
You realize what this is, it is the horn of the mythical unicorn. Amazing!

objects.ground: A dusty, ornate chest lies here, untouched in ages.

extras.text: A once beautiful chest has succumbed to time.  The beautiful wood is now cracked and warped, and it is covered by a thick coat of dust.

objects.ground: A marble statue, charred and broken, stands at the street's end.

extras.text: The statue is of a heroic-looking woman, but it's impossible to see her features or even what she's wearing and wielding. The statue is made of the finest white marble, but it's been burned and charred until it's barely recognizable as marble, and pieces of it lie on the ground around the ornate base.

objects.ground: A piece of burning wood lies here.

extras.text: As you look closer, you can see that the branch is wrapped with some kind of rag which smells like it is soaked in oil.  You can't help but wonder why someone would bring such a primitive light source in here...

objects.ground: A burning wooden ember smoulders here.
A torch stand rests here, casting light on the statue.

extras.text: This shaped piece of marble matches the statue it stands next to.  There is a torch standing, held in a clamp, casting light upon the statue and bathing the room in a soft glow.
This clamp seems to be for gripping a torch, which would be intended to cast light across the statue here.

objects.ground: A small orb of purple stone catches your attention.

extras.text: This small orb resembles an eye in exacting detail.

objects.ground: A piece of dark red leather glows slightly above the ground.

extras.text: A demonic glow surrounds this dark red hide hinting to the great power contained within it.  The skin is extremely rough and durable making it excellent armor.

objects.ground: A huge pile of money shines here.

extras.text: It's a huge pile of coins! Wahoo!

objects.ground: A large vial of thick viscous fluid lies here.

triggers.name: rock_demon_call_rock
triggers.commands: wait 1 s wecho The demon has animated some rocks which spin around you! wait 1 s set numhits %random.3% eval numhits %numhits% + 2 set thishit 0 while %thishit% < %numhits% set dmg %random.50% eval dmg %dmg% + 50 set rnd %random.char% if %rnd.vnum% == 52017 wechoaround %rnd% A lump of rock merges with %rnd.name% and he seems stronger! (&3%dmg%&0) wsend %rnd% You absorb strength from the rock! (&3%dmg%&0) wheal %rnd% %dmg% else if %rnd.quest_stage[meteorswarm]% == 2 || %rnd.quest_variable[meteorswarm:new]% /= yes if %rnd.quest_stage[meteorswarm]% == 2 quest advance meteorswarm %rnd% elseif %rnd.quest_variable[meteorswarm:new]% /= yes quest variable meteorswarm %rnd% new no endif wload obj 48252 wsend %rnd% &1&bA flaming meteor shoots off the towering rock demon,&0 wsend %rnd% &1&bsoars through the sky, and begins to fall toward the ground!&0 wechoaround %rnd% &1&bA flaming meteor shoots off the towering rock demon,&0 wechoaround %rnd% &1&bbut %rnd.name% catches it!&0 wforce %rnd% get meteorite wsend %rnd% &1&bYou now have an appropriate focus!&0 else wdamage %rnd% %dmg% crush if %damdone% == 0 wsend %rnd% A lump of rock whizzes right through you! wechoaround %rnd% %rnd.name% watches a rock zip right through %rnd.p% body. else wsend %rnd% A lump of rock whizzes towards you.  You can't dodge! (&1&b%damdone%&0) wechoaround %rnd% %rnd.name% gets whacked by a lump of flying rock! (&4%damdone%&0) endif endif endif eval thishit %thishit% + 1 done

triggers.name: grow_hydra_head
triggers.commands: * Only do this if killer %actor% exists, otherwise they were killed by death of body! if %actor% * return 0 for no death cry... return 0 * If killer holds a lit branch (obj 52034) then no new head set no_head 0 if (%actor.wearing[52035]%) set no_head %actor.wearing[52035]% elseif (%actor.wearing[52034]%) set no_head %actor.wearing[52034]% endif if %no_head% mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% seals the Hydra's neck with %no_head.shortdesc%, preventing another head from growing! msend %actor% You cauterize the wound with %no_head.shortdesc% - no more heads from there! elseif %random.100% > 65 mechoaround %actor% As soon as %actor.name% strikes the head from the body a new one grows! msend %actor% As soon as you chop the head off, another one starts to grow! mload mob 52009 else mechoaround %actor% As soon as %actor.name% strikes the head from the body TWO new ones grow! msend %actor% As soon as you chop the head off, TWO new ones appear! mload mob 52009 mload mob 52009 endif if %get.mob_count[52009]% >= 30 mecho The heads begin to scream and fly in all directions, and COMPLETELY ANNIHILATE YOU! endif endif

triggers.name: break_burning_branch
triggers.commands: wait 1 oecho The branch cracks and breaks into 3 pieces! oload obj 52035 oload obj 52035 oload obj 52035 opurge burning-branch

triggers.name: hydra_death_cry
triggers.commands: m_run_room_trig 52004

triggers.name: all_hydra_heads_die
triggers.commands: set person %self.people% while %person% set next %person.next_in_room% if %person.vnum% == 52009 wdamage %person% 50000 endif set person %next% done

triggers.name: UNUSED
triggers.commands: wait 5 if %smoke_demon% != pi if %actor.vnum% == -1 wload mob 52019 wecho A spirit demon forms out of the air around you. set smoke_demon pi global smoke_demon wforce spirit-demon kill %actor.name% endif endif

triggers.name: UNUSED
triggers.commands: * hope this works as well as the theory * idea is that this trigger runs _before_ players * enter. Course it only calcs the size of the last * group to enter, so if a player comes in later * the global var gets scragged :-( * hehe if only room had a vnum field this could be generic! set peeps %people.52059% wait 5 eval peeps %people.52059% - %peeps% global peeps

triggers.name: death_of_tree
triggers.commands: mload obj 52034 emote whispers 'Ah, the relief...' return 0

triggers.name: bronze_guard_greet1
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.level% > 100 glare %actor.name% say I was supposed to get PAID for this gig. poke %actor.name% else mechoaround %actor.name% The statue's eyes seem to follow %actor.name% around for a moment, they look a bit uncomfortable. msend %actor.name% The statue's eyes seem to stare directly at you for a moment, how disturbing. endif endif

triggers.name: Sagece_Attack
triggers.commands: wait 1s set value %random.10% switch %value% case 1 breath fire break case 2 case 3 sweep break case 4 case 5 roar break case 6 m_run_room_trig 52020 break case 7 m_run_room_trig 52021 break default growl done

triggers.name: sagece_greet1
triggers.commands: if %actor% && (%actor.level% < 100) emote screams, 'I have been waiting for you!!' kill %actor.name% if %actor.vnum% != -1 breath fire endif endif

triggers.name: dark_elf_open1
triggers.commands: if %arg% /= chest msend %actor% A dark elf stops you from opening a chest! mechoaround %actor% A dark elf jumps in %actor.name%'s way, keeping them from the chest! say Insolent fools!  Such blatant thievery. close panel west kill %actor.name% end if

triggers.name: assassin_greet1
triggers.commands: if %actor.level% < 100 emote whispers, 'Trespassers!' backstab %actor.name% else bow %actor.name% say Welcome, Diety. end

triggers.name: rock_demon_fight
triggers.commands: wait 1s emote starts to glow slightly and his eyes burn hotly. say uruk chachronu vuur emote gestures upwards with his hands. m_run_room_trig 52000

triggers.name: dying_tree_speak1
triggers.commands: sigh mecho %self.name% says, 'I was the Tree of Life, and now I live in agony mecho &0thanks to the Hydra's fire.  Kill me, and take a branch to help you kill the mecho &0Hydra.'

triggers.name: dying_tree_allgreet1
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 say %actor.name%, have you come to help me? endif

triggers.name: dying_tree_rand1
triggers.commands: switch %random.3% case 1 mecho A few falling leaves burst into flames as they get too close to the burning tree. break case 2 mecho The burning tree emits a loud hissing noise that startles a few nearby rodents. break case 3 emote curses the Hydra. break done

triggers.name: UNUSED
triggers.commands: unset smoke_demon

triggers.name: sagece squish
triggers.commands: wecho &6&bSagece of Raymif beats her monstrous wings, launching herself into the air!&0 wait 5s set victim 0 set count 0 while %victim% == 0 set victim %random.char% if %victim.vnum% == 52012 set victim 0 endif eval count %count% + 1 if %count% > 10 wecho &3Sagece of Raymif slowly returns to the floor, rattling the hall.&0 halt endif done wdamage %victim% 5000 crush wechoaround %victim% &6Sagece of Raymif swoops down, dropping her bulk onto %victim.name%!&0 (&4%damdone%&0) wsend %victim% &6Sagece of Raymif swoops down, dropping her massive bulk on &1&bYOU&0&6!&0 (&1%damdone%&0)

triggers.name: sagece fling
triggers.commands: set victim %random.char% if %victim.vnum% != 52012 eval damage 75 + %random.40% wechoaround %victim% &2Sagece of Raymif sweeps with her enormous tail, throwing %victim.name% from the area!&0 (&4%damage%&0) wsend %victim% &2Sagece of Raymif sweeps with her enormous tail, knocking you out of the area!&0 (&1&b%damage%&0) eval room 52082 + %random.5% if %room% == 52086 set room 52083 endif wteleport %victim% %room% wforce %victim% look endif

triggers.name: UNUSED
triggers.commands: mecho A HUGE glob of acid from Sagece's corpse spews forth and hits you. m_run_room_trig 52024

triggers.name: UNUSED
triggers.commands: m_run_room_trig 52022

triggers.name: UNUSED
triggers.commands: set damage %random.2000% while %people.52086% > 0 mdamage %random.char% %damage% done

triggers.name: rock_well_load_door
triggers.commands: wdoor 2201 up room 52039 wdoor 2201 up description A ruin mansion lies just above.  If only it was reachable. wdoor 2201 up name Basement Ceiling set person %self.people% while %person% if %person.quest_stage[meteorswarm]% == 2 || %person.quest_variable[meteorswarm:new]% /= yes if %person.quest_stage[meteorswarm]% == 2 quest advance meteorswarm %person.name% elseif %person.quest_variable[meteorswarm:new]% /= yes quest variable meteorswarm %person.name% new no endif wload obj 48252 wecho A flaming meteor shoots off the towering rock demon, soars through the sky, and begins to fall toward the ground! endif set person %person.next_in_room% done

triggers.name: rock_demon_walk_in
triggers.commands: msend %actor% The basement ceiling collapses in on itself sealing you in!

triggers.name: rock_well_death
triggers.commands: m_run_room_trig 52025

triggers.name: sagece-dead
triggers.commands: mat 52093 m_run_room_trig 52054

triggers.name: UNUSED
triggers.commands: wload obj 52052

triggers.name: hoard-door
triggers.commands: wdoor 52093 east flags abce wdoor 52093 east room 52094 wdoor 52093 east name panel massive wdoor 52093 east key 52013 wdoor 52094 west flags abc wdoor 52094 west room 52093 wdoor 52094 west name panel massive wdoor 52094 west key 52013

triggers.name: dark-elves-fight
triggers.commands: wait 2s hitall

rooms.name: Entrance Gate to Templace
rooms.description: A gigantic mass of carnage and rubble lies to the north of here.  Fires still burn uncontrolled spewing forth volumes of wretched black smoke.  Mounds of mangled and massacred bodies are strewn about.  Some of the creatures remain living by the barest thread, their moans of pain waft through the air.  To the north lie the rusted gates of Templace.  North of the gate, barely visible through the billowing black smoke, lies a rubble lined street that seems to head into the center of town.

North.description: The gate is made of bronze, and through it can be seen a rubble-strewn street of ancient stone.

South.description: You see a destroyed pathway.

extras.text: A large gate with thick metal bars stands here unweathered.

rooms.name: South Solin Street
rooms.description: Dark stains and moss cover the broken cobblestones lining this street. It heads generally toward the town, toward the decayed rubble of buildings that line the road. The debris is blackened and charred, but the fires must have occurred long ago, for no smells can be detected. The street extends northward, and the main gate is visible to the south.

North.description: The street extends northward, past destroyed buildings.

South.description: The gate is made of bronze, and outside is just a barren patch of land surrounded by charred trees.

rooms.name: South Solin Street
rooms.description: This street was once cobbled tidily, but now, battle and time have taken their toll. Rubble and debris litter the road, and the buildings that stood along it are charred hulks. The wind whistles past the ruins occasionally, but does not smell as if the fires that ravaged this city happened anytime recently. Some yellowed bones poke up out of the rubble here and there.

North.description: An intersection is visible to the north.

South.description: The street extends southward, ending at the gate.

extras.text: They look humanoid, and are yellowed with age. Most of them are broken. Sometimes a skull is even visible.

rooms.name: An Intersection Amid the Ruins
rooms.description: Two wide streets, both destroyed by battle, fire, and time, meet in this intersection. Piles of cobblestones and debris from fallen buildings are strewn around in a haphazard fashion. The marks of flames are evident everywhere as black, charred stone, but the fire is gone, and there is no sign of when it occurred. The main street continues to the north and south, while another one begins here and heads off to the east.

North.description: The corner of the street is visible.

East.description: Another street, not quite as wide, heads off to the east.

South.description: The street extends south a ways.

rooms.name: A Narrow, Rubble-Choked Lane
rooms.description: Ancient rubble is strewn across the surface of this narrow side street. Most of it comes from the fallen-down buildings lining the sides of the road, but the cobbles themselves are broken up. Almost all the stone visible bears the marks of fire, but the wind whistling through the ruins does not bring the scent of burning things. The street ends to the east, and to the west, it ends at a T-intersection.

East.description: The street ends to the east.

West.description: The street ends to the west, at a T-intersection.

rooms.name: A Narrow, Rubble-Choked Lane
rooms.description: Ancient rubble is strewn across the surface of this narrow side street. Most of it comes from the fallen-down buildings lining the sides of the road, but the cobbles themselves are broken up. Almost all the stone visible bears the marks of fire, but the wind whistling through the ruins does not bring the scent of burning things. The road ends here, but extends west a short distance.

West.description: The street extends west a short ways.

rooms.name: A Bend in South Solin Street
rooms.description: The wide main street of the town makes a turn here, heading south and west past decayed, destroyed buildings. The street itself was once cobbled, but now the stones are ripped up and lying in heaps here and there. There are many signs of fire damage, but the air just smells musty.

South.description: The street forms a T-intersection to the south.

West.description: The street makes another turn to the west.

rooms.name: A Bend in South Solin Street
rooms.description: The wide main street of the town makes a turn here, heading north and east past decayed, destroyed buildings. The street itself was once cobbled, but now the stones are ripped up and lying in heaps here and there. There are many signs of fire damage, but the air just smells musty.

North.description: A city square, also destroyed by fire and time, lies northward.

East.description: The street makes another turn here.

rooms.name: A Ruined Town Center
rooms.description: This town center is quite spacious, and once might have been inviting and picturesque. Now it is a ruins, with the cobbles comprising it torn and scattered into piles, and the quaint shops that once stood along its edges collapsed. The signs of massive fire damage are everywhere, but the air is clear and just smells musty. This is the southeast corner of the square. It continues on to the north and west.

North.description: The town center continues on to the north.

West.description: The town center continues on to the west.

rooms.name: A Ruined Town Center
rooms.description: This town center is quite spacious, and once might have been inviting and picturesque. Now it is a ruins, with the cobbles comprising it torn and scattered into piles, and the quaint shops that once stood along its edges collapsed. The signs of massive fire damage are everywhere, but the air is clear and just smells musty. The town center extends to the east, north, and west, and another street runs off to the south.

North.description: The middle of the town center lies northward. A broken fountain can be seen there.

East.description: The town center extends to the east.

South.description: A road leads off to the south.

rooms.name: A Ruined Town Center
rooms.description: This town center is quite spacious, and once might have been inviting and picturesque. Now it is a ruins, with the cobbles comprising it torn and scattered into piles, and the quaint shops that once stood along its edges collapsed. The signs of massive fire damage are everywhere, but the air is clear and just smells musty. This the southwest corner of the square. It extends north and east.

North.description: The town center continues northward.

rooms.name: A Ruined Town Center
rooms.description: This town center is quite spacious, and once might have been inviting and picturesque. Now it is a ruins, with the cobbles comprising it torn and scattered into piles, and the quaint shops that once stood along its edges collapsed. The signs of massive fire damage are everywhere, but the air is clear and just smells musty. The town center extends to the north and south, with its middle visible to the east. A narrow street leads off west, past more ruins.

North.description: The town center extends to the north.

East.description: The middle of the town center is visible not far away, with a broken fountain standing there.

South.description: The corner of the town square is visible to the south.

West.description: A narrow street, also marked by rubble and charring, leads off west.

rooms.name: A Ruined Fountain
rooms.description: This used to be a picturesque town center, and here was its middle. But its cobblestones are destroyed, piled in small heaps here and there, and the marks of extensive fire damage are everywhere. Despite this, the air just smells musty, not at all like how one would expect it to after a great conflagration. The ruins of shops are visible not far away at the edges of the town square, all bearing the same burnmarks.

North.description: The town center extends northward.

South.description: The town center extends southward.

rooms.name: A Ruined Town Center
rooms.description: This town center is quite spacious, and once might have been inviting and picturesque. Now it is a ruins, with the cobbles comprising it torn and scattered into piles, and the quaint shops that once stood along its edges collapsed. The signs of massive fire damage are everywhere, but the air is clear and just smells musty. The town center continues on to the north, south, and west, with a narrow street leaving it to the east.

North.description: The northeast corner of the town center is visible to the north.

East.description: A narrow street, filled with debris, leads off to the east.

South.description: The town center continues to the south.

West.description: A broken fountain marks the middle of the town center.

rooms.name: A Ruined Town Center
rooms.description: This town center is quite spacious, and once might have been inviting and picturesque. Now it is a ruins, with the cobbles comprising it torn and scattered into piles, and the quaint shops that once stood along its edges collapsed. The signs of massive fire damage are everywhere, but the air is clear and just smells musty. This is the northeast corner of the town center. It continues on to the south and west.

South.description: The town center extends to the south.

West.description: The town center extends to the west.

rooms.name: A Ruined Town Center
rooms.description: This town center is quite spacious, and once might have been inviting and picturesque. Now it is a ruins, with the cobbles comprising it torn and scattered into piles, and the quaint shops that once stood along its edges collapsed. The signs of massive fire damage are everywhere, but the air is clear and just smells musty. The town center extends to the east, west, and south, with a wide street leaving it to the north.

North.description: A wide street, marred by debris, leaves the square to the north.

East.description: The town center extends to the east.

South.description: A broken fountain marks the middle of the town center.

West.description: The town center extends to the west.

rooms.name: A Ruined Town Center
rooms.description: This town center is quite spacious, and once might have been inviting and picturesque. Now it is a ruins, with the cobbles comprising it torn and scattered into piles, and the quaint shops that once stood along its edges collapsed. The signs of massive fire damage are everywhere, but the air is clear and just smells musty. This is the northwest corner of the square. It continues on to the south and east.

East.description: The town center continues on to the east.

South.description: The town center continues on to the east.

rooms.name: West Markis Street
rooms.description: This ancient street is in ruins, and the houses on either side of it are in horrible disrepair. Most of them are barely husks, but a few still have some walls standing. All of the buildings are blackened and charred from fire damage, but the air doesn't smell like the fires occurred any time recently. The cobbles of the street are piled up here and there, and the condition of the street worsens to the west. The town square, or what's left of it, lies eastward.

rooms.name: Street Intersection
rooms.description: The ruined cobblestone street forms a T-intersection here, with the narrow road running east, west, and north. Some buildings stand along the road, but they are, for the most part, hulking ruins, lacking roofs and usually walls. There is extensive evidence of massive fire damage, though it must have occurred long ago; more puzzling to most people are the huge gouges in the sides of the buildings and in the street. The cobbles of the street are largely missing and eroded, and piled up in places.

West.description: The street makes a turn here.

rooms.name: Corner of West Markis Street
rooms.description: This narrow cobbled street makes a turn here, heading east and south past ruined houses. Most of them still stand, but they are in horrible disrepair, with caved-in roofs and vast gouges in their walls that look almost like they were caused by giant claws. The street itself is in rubble, with many stones missing.

East.description: The street extends to the east a bit.

South.description: The street turns to the south.

rooms.name: West Markis Street
rooms.description: A narrow cobbled street falls to rubble here. Most of the buildings to its east and west remain standing, but time and catastrophe have rendered them unfit for habitation. The street itself disintegrates into a dirt path to the south, with the stones that once lined the street mixed up with rusted armor and weapons. Some of the buildings bear humongous gouges in their stone surfaces.

North.description: The street extends to the north.

South.description: A narrow little path leads off to the south, toward a hill.

rooms.name: A Dark Path
rooms.description: This is the end of a short path. The town road to the north fades from view through the thick, dead branches of the charred trees lining the path. Sometimes bones can be seen protruding from the blackened ground, and many of these bear bite marks upon their surfaces. The surface of a hill protrudes up from the ground to the southeast, its surface black and unpleasant- looking.

East.description: The surface of the hill near here is rough to the touch.

rooms.name: Entrance to a Giant Cave
rooms.description: The dark path to the west forms a sort of semicircle before the mouth of a gigantic cave.  The walls and floor of the cave appear to be composed of igneous rock, formed by volcanic activity.  No vegetation grows anywhere nearby, and the few trees around look like they died of fire damage many years ago.

West.description: The cave wall feels rough to the touch.

rooms.name: North Markis Street
rooms.description: The cobblestone street here is littered with stone and ash.  Most of the buildings have been destroyed.  There are a few fires still sputtering out that black, acrid smoke.  There is a noticeable lack of junked battle equipment. Thick dark smoke from other parts of Templace make the visibility very poor. The cobblestone street heads to the north and south.

North.description: Corner of Dethrowe Street

South.description: Corner of Dethrowe Street

rooms.name: Corner of North Markis Street
rooms.description: The cobblestone street makes a turn here, heading south and west past ancient, ruined buildings. Some of them even appear to be standing, and bear few marks of battle or fire. The roofs are universally caved in, however. Once this area must have been palatial, but now it is just an old ruin. A courtyard of some sort is visible to the east.

East.description: A courtyard opens up to the east.

West.description: The street ends to the west.

rooms.name: A Ruined White Courtyard
rooms.description: This small courtyard is utterly silent, but in ruins. Time appears to be what destroyed most of the buildings, statuary, and cobblestones; there is little evidence of fire damage, and no sign of battle. An airy white gazebo stands to the north, unaccountably undamaged. A street runs to the west.

North.description: The gazebo is very large and spotlessly white.

West.description: A street runs off to the west.

rooms.name: A White Gazebo
rooms.description: This large, finely decorated gazebo is made of hardwood painted white. Oddly, it remains undamaged by time or fire, and stands out conspicuously against the wreckage of the courtyard to the south. Steps lead down to the courtyard, and benches set around the gazebo invite people to take their ease and admire the many carvings that adorn the posts and railings of the wooden structure.

South.description: The steps lead down into a ruined courtyard.

extras.text: It reads: Dedicated to the kind people of Templace. Clan of Ne'Kaaz
A silken cushion, now faded and mildewed, covers this beautiful bench.  A small brass plate is fixed to the side of the bench.

rooms.name: North Markis Street
rooms.description: The ruined cobblestone street comes to an end here. Many of the buildings standing along it are still standing, but are still charred and scorched. The air smells musty, though, so the fires could not have occurred recently. Some shops stand to the north and west.

North.description: A shop stands here. Amazingly, its door is still attached.

East.description: The street continues to the east.

West.description: An abandoned shop stands here. Amazingly, its door still hangs in its frame.

rooms.name: Ironsmith's Shop
rooms.description: This abandoned shop is covered in a layer of dust, and its roof has long ago caved in, covering the ground with disintegrating thatching. The tools littering the ground are rusted to the point of not being recognizable anymore, and the wooden furniture and racks are pounded into the ground. The shop's door stands in the south wall, amazingly still intact.

South.description: The door stands in the south wall.

rooms.name: An Abandoned Weapons Shop
rooms.description: The interior of this ancient shop has been thoroughly destroyed, and now rusted weapons lie on the floor amid the wreckage of the wooden counters and racks. Dust coats everything. Amazingly, the roof is still largely intact, and the door even swings crazily on its hinge.

East.description: The shop's door stands at a crazy angle on its hinges.

rooms.name: East Markis Street
rooms.description: A narrow cobblestone street winds east and west past what used to be small shops, with some homes interspersed between them. Though there is little evidence of fire damage, time has taken its toll on these buildings; most of them have become ruins, with fallen-in roofs and broken stone walls. A town center of sorts lies to the west.

rooms.name: Street Intersection
rooms.description: A ruined street meets another, running north-south, at this T-intersection. The cobbles lining the street are in bad condition, with many missing, and forming rough heaps here and there in the street. The buildings standing around here are in fairly good shape, with light scorching visible on their walls. They are, however, ruins, with their roofs caved in, and strange gouge marks evident here and there. One street leads off to the north and south, with another heading west.

West.description: A street extends a short ways to the west.

rooms.name: Shrikat Street
rooms.description: This decaying street is made of cobblestones, but it is in bad shape, with heaps of rubble all over the place. It runs from north to south past ruined buildings that bear marks of scorching and gouging. The roofs are all caved in, and most of the walls are half-disassembled and lying in heaps of stones. To the south, a T-intersection is visible, and not far to the east, a tall, blackened tower rises above the city.

rooms.name: A Bend in Shrikat Street
rooms.description: This narrow street is made up of cobblestones, but it has clearly been destroyed by time and battle. Many stones are missing, and others are either pounded and rotted to dust, or lying in piles here and there. The street, what's left of it, runs from east to south past equally decayed buildings. The marks of fire are evident, though the air smells merely musty now. A tall tower is visible to the east, not far away.

rooms.name: Shrikat Street
rooms.description: The street comes to an end here, and is in no better condition here than it is to the west, where it turns past ruined houses. The houses visible here look more like mansions; each is, or was, large, with gardens and stone walls around it. Now, however, the houses are destroyed, many bearing the marks of fire damage, and their walls, like the street, are half-disassembled, with the stones either rotted away or lying in heaps here and there. A dark stone tower stands to the south, past a courtyard.

rooms.name: Tower Entrance
rooms.description: This is the entrance to a rather large, dark, stone tower.  Every square inch of the tower is covered in intricate glyphs and carvings.  The doors to the tower, well over fifteen feet high, are just as intricately decorated. The courtyard is strangely quiet.  The black smoke, so dense throughout the of here.  Rest of the town, is thankfully absent. A cobblestone street lies to the north of here.

South.description: A huge set of tower doors sit here, covered with strange glyphs and carvings.

rooms.name: Shrikat Street
rooms.description: A narrow, cobbled street runs north-south past some badly decayed and destroyed houses. Time has done most of the destruction visible around here, pulling down roofs, caving in walls, and wreaking havoc on the cobbles of the street. Fire damage is evident in the blackened scorchmarks that can be seen on the buildings and cobbles. The street moves south of here, then appears to head east.  Northward lies a T-intersection.

rooms.name: Shrikat Street
rooms.description: A narrow cobblestone street runs a short way to the east and north past decayed, ruined buildings. Most of them seem like they were homes, but they are rubble now, with caved-in roofs and walls that are no longer whole, but lean at alarming angles, half-dismantled stones in piles around their bases. The street itself is not in much better shape, with cobbles missing and forming piles of rubble here and there. Scorchmarks and gouges in the buildings and walls indicate that more than time has destroyed this area. The street extends to the east and north.

rooms.name: A Turn in Shrikat Street
rooms.description: A narrow road twists around decayed, ruined houses. There is little evidence of scorchmarks here, but the roofs of the buildings are still caved in, and the walls are half-dismantled. The road itself is in very bad shape, making walking on it treacherous. A large house, decayed but clearly once a mansion, stands to the south.

South.description: A broken oak door hangs onto the frame by one last hinge.

rooms.name: An Abandoned House
rooms.description: This used to be a stately mansion, but now it's a hulking ruin. The furniture has long ago decomposed into matchsticks and dust, and the walls lean at crazy angles. The roof is mostly caved in, leaving only a skeletal framework of rotting timbers. The floor was once red-tinted tiling, but a large, gaping hole takes up most of it, revealing the basement below. Scorchmarks and gouges are visible in the rubbled walls, evidence of violence done long ago.

North.description: A broken oak door hangs onto the frame by one last hinge.

Down.description: The basement is visible through the floor. It's not in much better shape than the house itself.

rooms.name: North Solin Street
rooms.description: There are numerous darkly colored stains that cover this old cobblestone street that leads to the great citadel.  Rubble lines the side of the road from destroyed buildings.  Black, billowing, acrid smoke emanates from the burning rubble, making it rather hard to see more than a few feet.  There is a humanoid skull impaled on a large spear here.  The street continues to the north, while the town center is barely visible to the south.

rooms.name: North Solin Street
rooms.description: The darkly colored stains are even more numerous on this section of the old cobblestone street.  Various skeletal appendages protrude from the rubble that lines the street here.  The rubble still burns fiercely, producing vast amounts of smoke.  The black, acrid smoke hangs heavy in the air, reducing the visibility greatly.  A great moat that surrounds the citadel to the north is barely visible through the billowing smoke.  The street continues south through the choking darkness.

rooms.name: Hidden Room
rooms.description: This dry, quiet room is covered in a layer of dust. The walls were once painted, but the paint's been eroded for years. There is little here of interest, only some shelves on the wall. The panel to the south is clearly visible on this side of the door.

South.description: A panel is set in the wall.

rooms.name: Mist Shrouded Moat
rooms.description: An ancient stone bridge used to span the murky moat here.  Parts of the bridge, where it collapsed, are barely visibly through the mist and murk far below.  Dark shapes and gentle ripples are the only things that disturb the calm waters.  The citadel courtyard is visible to the north while an old cobblestone street lies to the south.

rooms.name: The Citadel Courtyard
rooms.description: This is the giant courtyard before the gates of the citadel.  The view afforded here of the town must have been impressive once.  Now all that is visible is destruction and burning wreckage.  The citadel of Templace lies to the north and east of here.  The moat surrounding the citadel lies to the south.

rooms.name: The Citadel Gates
rooms.description: Before you lies, the gates to the citadel of Templace.  The citadel is black and massive, spanning upwards an untold number of stories.  The black and wrought iron gates of the citadel are no less then massive.  The citadel seems to pulse with a life entirely unto itself.  A shimmering wall lies to the west. The gates of the citadel lie to the north.

North.description: Massive black gates many feet in height, stand unaffected by the elements or the passage of time.

rooms.name: A Dark Room
rooms.description: Though this little room used to be a basement, it's been out of use for many years. There are no furnishings, and the paint on the walls long ago peeled away. The floor is slippery and pockmarked, and the room itself is dark. The ceiling, above, is riddled with holes.

North.description: The wall is slightly cracked.

rooms.name: The Bottom of the Tower
rooms.description: The bottom of this tower gives a glorious view upwards, showing exactly how tall the building truly is.  The walls are covered in Glyphs and Tapestries that have developed a thick layer of dust over them.  The shadow of something or someone occasionally can be seen from the stairs above.  This room is large and seems like it was once outside due to the weathering of the smoothe stone surface of the floor.  In the center of the room a large bowl shaped hole is smoothly hewn into the stone.  Twenty or so warriors could stand in its depth and easily walk out of the stairs exiting the bowl in the cardinal directions.  Vegitation seems to have eaten at this entire area in some distant past before all the destruction before you....

rooms.name: An Underground Chamber
rooms.description: A mass of tangled, moss-covered roots cover the bare earthen walls, but most of them are long dead, withered and white. The floor is a mixture of brown earth and some sort of coarse white pebbly material. Any noise made down here is echoed until it sounds like it's bouncing far down the tunnel to the north. A trapdoor hangs overhead.

North.description: The tunnel goes to the north for a short distance.

Up.description: A trapdoor hangs down from the ceiling, with a rickety wooden staircase leading up to it.

rooms.name: An Underground Chamber
rooms.description: The humidity in the room drenches everything in a thin film of water here. A mass of tangled dirt and moss crusted roots cover the bare earthen walls. The floor here is mainly a coarse white substance, and it is littered with crushed bones.  Centipedes and a number of unidentifiable bugs crawl along the ceiling and walls.  The echoes here are magnified greatly, as each little noise sounds like a banshee's wail.  The earthen tunnel leads off to the north and east.

rooms.name: An Underground Chamber
rooms.description: A mass of tangled dirt and moss crusted roots cover the bare earthen walls here.  The dampness of this tunnel makes the air thick and difficult to breathe.  The floor here is littered with broken bones.  Bugs scatter from beneath everything that is disturbed.  The echoes here are magnified greatly, as each little noise sounds like a banshee's wail.  The earthen tunnel leads off to the east, south and west.

rooms.name: An Underground Chamber
rooms.description: The humidity in this tunnel causes everything to be coated in a thin film of water.  A mass of tangled dirt and moss crusted roots cover the bare earthen walls.  The floor is mainly a coarse white substance, and it is littered with crushed bones.  Centipedes and other unidentifiable bugs crawl along the ceiling and a walls.  The earthen tunnel leads off to the north and west.  The earthen tunnel leads off to the north and east.

rooms.name: An Underground Chamber
rooms.description: The high humidity in this section of the tunnel makes the air almost to thick to breath.  A mass of tangled fungus crusted roots cover the bare earthen walls here.  A lifelike statue is propped up against the earthen wall, it's face contorted in an agonizing grimace.  The floor here is littered with broken bones.  Various sized bugs are everywhere, creating a living carpet across the floor.  The echoes here are magnified greatly, each little noise sounds like a banshee's wail.  The earthen tunnel leads off to the west and south.

extras.text: This ultra-realisitc statue is of a warrior, in full battle armor.  The details are magnificant, right down to the intricacy on the coat of arms that is on his shield.  His face has a look of horrific terror and anguish.

rooms.name: An Underground Chamber
rooms.description: The humidity here makes the air almost to thick to breath.  A mass of tangled dirt covered roots line the earthen walls here.  The floor here is littered with bone fragments and crushed skulls.  Giant insects crawl among the bones nesting in the hollow shells of skulls.  The echoes here are magnified greatly, each little noise sounding like a banshee's wail.  The earthen tunnel leads off to the east and west.

rooms.name: An Underground Chamber
rooms.description: The humidity here permeates the air, covering everything in a thin film of slimy water.  A mass of tangled dirt and fungus crusted roots cover the bare earthen walls.  The floor is littered with broken bones and a fine white powder.  Insects crawl on the walls and ceilings, and nest in the hollow shells of skulls.  All sounds here are magnified greatly, each little noise echoes loudly throughout this subterranean world.  The earthen tunnel leads off to the south and east.

rooms.name: A Giant Cave
rooms.description: The cave here is immense.  Jagged igneous rocks make traveling in this place very difficult.  Huge stalactites hang overheard ready to impale unsuspecting passersby.  The floor is somewhat smoothed out, as it is not as jagged as the walls and ceiling.  The entrance to the cave hangs overhead.  The cave continues farther in to the north.

rooms.name: A Giant Cave
rooms.description: The cave here is immense.  The walls and ceiling, from what can be seen, are a beautiful dark crimson color.  The ceiling of the cave cannot be seen, but many large stalactites hang perilously overheard.  The walls are extremely rough, perhaps forged by fire or by ancient volcanic activity.  The floor is smooth, almost to the point of being treacherously slippery.  The cave continues farther to the south and west.

rooms.name: A Giant Cave
rooms.description: The cave here is immense.  The walls and ceiling, from what can be seen, are a beautiful dark crimson color.  The ceiling of the cave cannot be seen, but many large stalactites hang perilously overheard.  The walls are extremely rough, perhaps forged by fire or by ancient volcanic activity.  The floor is smooth, almost to the point of being treacherously slippery.  The cave continues farther on to the north, or one could head back to the mouth to the east.

rooms.name: A Giant Cave
rooms.description: The cave here is immense.  The walls and ceiling, from what can be seen, are a beautiful dark crimson color.  The ceiling of the cave cannot be seen, but many large stalactites hang perilously overhead.  The walls are extremely rough, perhaps forged by fire or by ancient volcanic activity.  The floor is smooth, almost to the point of being treacherously slippery.  The cave continues farther to the south and east.

rooms.name: A Giant Cave
rooms.description: The immense cave comes to an end here.  The walls and floor are a dark crimson color.  Giant boulders litter the floor and line most of the walls. Huge stalactites hang from an unseen heights, sharp stalagmites jut from the floor hoping some day to reach their brothers heights.  The floor is treacherous, and it'd be quite easy to lose footing on its smooth surface. The cave's mouth is visible to the west.

rooms.name: The Tower Foyer
rooms.description: This is the foyer of the main tower where the owner used to entertain his guests and hold audiences.  A thick layer of dust has settled over everything. Glyphs seem to adorn the room.  Nothing of value or interest seems to here. Tapestries line the walls, depicting scenes from epic battles.  The strange symbols and heavily decorated tower doors are to the north.  There is plain wooden door set in to the east wall.

rooms.name: A Hall
rooms.description: Dust coats everything in the hallway here.  The hall here is completely silent, blocking out all noise from the outside of the tower.  Every square inch of the walls and ceilings are covered in glyphs and carvings.  There is a small arrow slit window, apparently for archers, here giving a view of the courtyard surrounding the tower.  There is a simple door on the west wall here. The hallway continues to the south.

rooms.name: A Hall
rooms.description: Dust coats everything in the hallway here.  The hall here is completely silent, blocking out all noise from the outside of the tower.  Every square inch of the walls and ceilings are covered in glyphs and carvings.  There is a small arrow slit window, apparently for archers, here giving a view of the courtyard surrounding the tower.  There is a simple door on the west wall here. The hallway continues to the north.

rooms.name: A Stair Landing
rooms.description: Dust coats everything on the stair landing here.  The landing is completely silent, blocking out all noise from the outside of the tower.  Every square inch of the landing walls are covered in glyphs and carvings.  The stairs here are completely covered with shimmering and writhing symbols.  There is a simple door on the east wall here.  The stairs lead upward.

rooms.name: A Stair Landing
rooms.description: Dust coats everything on the stair landing here.  The landing is completely silent, blocking out all noise from the outside of the tower.  Every square inch of the landing walls are covered in glyphs and carvings.  The stairs here are completely covered with shimmering and writhing symbols.  There is a simple door on the east wall here.  The stairs lead upward.

rooms.name: A Hall
rooms.description: A thick, undisturbed, layer of dust coats the entire stretch of this hallway.  The massive stone walls block out all noise from outside of the tower, making it deathly silent.  The walls and ceiling are covered in glyphs and carvings that are quite foreign.  There is a small arrow slit window, presumably once used by archers, which gives a view of the destroyed town that surrounds the tower.  There is a simple door on the west wall here.  The hallway continues to the south.

rooms.name: A Hall
rooms.description: A thick, undisturbed, layer of dust coats the entire stretch of this hallway.  The massive stone walls block out all noise from outside of the tower, making it deathly silent.  The walls and ceiling are covered in glyphs and carvings that are quite foreign.  There is a small arrow slit window, presumably once used by archers, which gives a view of the destroyed town that surrounds the tower.  There is a simple door on the west wall here.  The hallway continues to the north.

rooms.name: A Stair Landing
rooms.description: Dust coats everything on the stair landing here.  It is completely silent, blocking out all noise from the outside of the tower.  Every square inch of the ceilings and walls are covered in glyphs and carvings.  The stairs are solid, despite their age.  The are constructed from highly polished marble, with dark blue veins.  There is a simple door on the east wall here.  The stairs lead downward.

rooms.name: A Stair Landing
rooms.description: Dust coats everything on the stair landing here.  It is completely silent, blocking out all noise from the outside of the tower.  Every square inch of the ceilings and walls are covered in glyphs and carvings.  The stairs are solid, despite their age.  The are constructed from highly polished marble, with dark blue veins.  There are two mahogany doors, one to the east, on to the south. The stairs lead downward.

rooms.name: The Mage's Workshop
rooms.description: Light emanates from the ceiling without a source here.  Cluttered worktables line the walls.  Every sort of magical device ever imagined lies littered among the tables here, either complete or in the process of completion.  The dust that choked the lower levels of the tower is nonexistent here.  No windows adorn the workshop, a simple door is set into the west wall.  The workshop continues to the south.

rooms.name: The Mage's Workshop
rooms.description: Light emanates from the ceiling without a source here.  Cluttered worktables line the walls.  Every sort of magical device ever imagined lies littered among the tables here, either complete or in the process of completion.  The dust that choked the lower levels of the tower is nonexistent here.  No windows adorn the workshop.  The workshop continues to the north and west.

rooms.name: The Mage's Workshop
rooms.description: Light emanates from the ceiling without a source here.  Cluttered worktables line the walls.  Every sort of magical device ever imagined lies littered among the tables here, either complete or in the process of completion.  The dust that choked the lower levels of the tower is nonexistent here.  No windows adorn the workshop.  A simple door is set into the north wall.  The workshop continues to the east.

rooms.name: The Citadel Entrance
rooms.description: This is the entrance to the great citadel of Templace.  A great hall spreads out to the north.  The floor is comprised of a glossy jet black marble. Beautifully colored, massive sized paintings hang from the jet-black marble walls, depicting gruesome acts of devastation and carnage.  A great black dragon is depicted in almost every scene of the paintings.  A gloomy light emanates from an unidentifiable source.  The massive black gates to the citadel are to the south.  The great hall leads farther to the north.

rooms.name: The Citadel Main Hall
rooms.description: This is the great hall of the citadel of Templace.  The floor here is a glossy jet-black marble.  Beautifully colored, massive sized paintings hang from the jet-black marble walls here depicting gruesome acts of devastation and carnage.  A great black dragon is depicted in almost every scene of the paintings.  A gloomy light emanates from an unidentifiable source in the lofty vaulted ceiling.  The great hall continues farther to the north and south.  A highly decorated door adorns the east wall.

rooms.name: The Hall of Tapestries
rooms.description: The floor here is a glossy jet-black marble.  Massive tapestries adorn the finely finished walls, depicting gruesome acts of devastation and carnage. Among the scenes of the devastation, an intricate network of glyphs has been sewn.  A gloomy light emanates from pitch-black torches.  The hall opens to the north, a highly decorated door adorns the west wall.

rooms.name: The Altar of Sagece
rooms.description: Adorning the north wall lies a massive black altar.  Placed upon the altar is a giant stone statue of a massive black dragon.  The walls here are adorned with massive tapestries depicting scenes of destruction.  A massive torch burns at each of the four corners of the room.  There appears to be an inscription written upon the altar.  The Hall of Tapestries lies to the south.

extras.text: The inscription reads plainly: In homage of Sagece of Raymif, master of Templace.

rooms.name: End of the Citadel Main Hall
rooms.description: This is the great hall of the citadel of Templace.  The floor here is a glossy jet-black marble.  Beautifully colored, massive sized paintings hang from the jet-black marble walls here depicting gruesome acts of devastation and carnage.  A great black dragon is depicted in almost every scene of the paintings.  A gloomy light emanates from an unidentifiable source in the lofty vaulted ceiling.  The great hall continues to the south, and there is a magnificient marble staircase lying to the west of here.

rooms.name: Stairs in the Citadel
rooms.description: The massive black marble staircase here soars up into the heights of this massive citadel.  Paintings of mass destruction and carnage adorn the walls. In each painting is a gigantic black dragon.  Massive black stone torches line walls every few steps, providing light for the stairs.  The massive staircase continues upwards.  The great hall lies to the east.

rooms.name: The Citadel Stair Landing
rooms.description: The massive black marble staircase comes to a landing here before a massive set of doors.  Intricate scenes of destruction have been carved into the gold plated doors.  The landing provides a view of the great hall spreading out into the darkness to the south and below.  The details of the hall are barely discernible from the height of this landing.  A staircase leads downward and a set of massive doors lie to the north.

North.description: A set of intricately carved golden doors are here.

rooms.name: The Great Hall of Sagece
rooms.description: The massive walls of the great hall are adorned with intricately woven tapestries and fine paintings.  They depict a gigantic black dragon ruling supreme over its conquered foes.  The sides of the great hall are supported by black pillars carved to resemble giant humanoids.  The great hall continues to to the north and east.

rooms.name: The Great Hall of Sagece
rooms.description: This is the entrance of the great hall.  The massive vaulted ceiling is lost in the murky heights.  Dark iron sconces hold torches, firmly attached the pillars, providing light.  To the north, visible in the distance, lies a massive throne.  To the south are the massive gold plated doors of the great hall.  The great hall continues to the east, west and north.

rooms.name: The Great Hall of Sagece
rooms.description: The massive walls of the great hall are adorned with intricately woven tapestries and fine paintings.  All of which depict a gigantic black dragon ruling supreme over its conquered foes.  The sides of the great hall are supported by massive black pillars carved to resemble giant humanoids.  The great hall continues to the north and west.

rooms.name: The Great Hall of Sagece
rooms.description: The massive walls of the great hall are adorned with intricately woven tapestries and fine paintings.  All of which depict a gigantic black dragon ruling supreme over its conquered foes.  The sides of the great hall are supported by massive black pillars carved to resemble giant humanoids.  The great hall continues to the north, south and west.

rooms.name: The Great Hall of Sagece
rooms.description: This is the center of the great hall.  The massive vaulted ceiling is lost in the dark iron sconces adorn the pillars, providing ample light.  The reflections of the torches on the floor gives the illusion of a mutlitude of lights, almost as if it were the middle of the day.  Just to the north lies a massive golden throne.  The great hall continues to the east, west, north and south.

rooms.name: The Great Hall of Sagece
rooms.description: The massive walls of the great hall are adorned with intricately woven tapestries and fine paintings.  All of which depict a gigantic black dragon ruling supreme over its conquered foes.  The sides of the great hall are supported by massive black pillars carved to resembe giant humanoids.  The great hall continues to the north, south and east.

rooms.name: The Great Hall of Sagece
rooms.description: The massive walls of the great hall are adorned with intricately woven tapestries and fine paintings.  All of which depict a gigantic black dragon ruling supreme over its conquered foes.  The sides of the great hall are supported by massive black pillars carved to resembe giant humanoids.  The great hall continues to the south and east.

rooms.name: The Throne of Sagece
rooms.description: Raised upon a black stone dais sits a massive throne.  The throne is solid gold with gemstones pounded into the surface.  The arm rests are made to resemble giant golden skulls.  Two huge gem encrusted sconces hang behind the throne providing light that is almost blinding, as it reflects off the throne. The great hall lies to the east, west and south.

rooms.name: The Great Hall of Sagece
rooms.description: The massive walls of the great hall are adorned with intricately woven tapestries and fine paintings.  All of which depict a gigantic black dragon ruling supreme over its conquered foes.  The sides of the great hall are supported by massive black pillars carved to resemble giant humanoids.  The great hall continues to the south and west.

rooms.name: A Dark Slippery Staircase
rooms.description: The staircase here has been worn almost completely smooth by the passage of a great bulk.  Moisture covers everything making the stone rather slippery. Massive carvings that once adorned the walls have now been almost completely scraped away.  Large black torches light the staircase.  A massive trapdoor hangs above.  The staircase continues downward.

rooms.name: An Underground Chamber
rooms.description: Standing in this massive underground chamber, it rather obvious that the floor here has been greatly smoothed out, as if a great bulk had been dragged across it an untold number of times.  Brightly burning black torches line the walls of the chamber, providing ample illumination.  Intricate designs have been carved into every square inch of the walls and ceiling of the chamber. The echoes of dripping water, filters through the chamber.  It continues to the south, while a well-worn staircase continues upward.

rooms.name: An Underground Chamber
rooms.description: Standing in this massive underground chamber, it rather obvious that the floor here has been greatly smoothed out, as if a great bulk had been dragged across it an untold number of times.  Brightly burning black torches line the walls of the chamber, providing ample illumination.  Intricate designs have been carved into every square inch of the walls and ceiling of the chamber. The echoes of dripping water, filters through the chamber.  There is a massive pool to the south of here, the chamber also continues to the east and north.

rooms.name: An Underground Pool
rooms.description: The underground pool and its surrounding rock formations give this area an extremely tranquil illusion, belying the destruction that was wrought overhead. The edges to the pool here have been worn smooth.  More of the massive black torches ring the pool here.  The reflection of the light off the surface brightens the room to a normal daylight glow.  The bottom of the pool is clearly visible beneath the surface.  There is a large underground chamber to the north.

rooms.name: An Underground Chamber
rooms.description: Standing in this massive underground chamber, it rather obvious that the floor here has been greatly smoothed out, as if a great bulk had been dragged across it an untold number of times.  Brightly burning black torches line the walls of the chamber, providing ample illumination.  Intricate designs have been carved into every square inch of the walls and ceiling.  The echoes of dripping water, filters through the chamber.  The chamber continues to west and north.

rooms.name: An Underground Chamber
rooms.description: Standing in this massive underground chamber, it rather obvious that the floor here has been greatly smoothed out, as if a great bulk had been dragged across it an untold number of times.  Brightly burning black torches line the walls of the chamber, providing ample illumination.  Intricate designs have been carved into every square inch of the walls and ceiling.  The echoes of footsteps resonate here, as the chamber comes to an end.

rooms.name: Dragon Hoard Room
rooms.description: This small rooms appears to be a melted alcove in the solid stone.  The walls and floor are rough, and contain much igneous rock.  There is treasure heaped all about the room.  Coins are piled all around.  Rare gems are stuffed into overflowing chests.  Unique and rare items are strewn all about.  Pieces of finely crafted armor hang from the walls, while the gem encrusted hilts of swords stick out from among the seas of fortune.

rooms.name: In the Murky Moat
rooms.description: The water here is murky and thick with silt.  Light barely penetrates through the dense fog and smoke.  Large shapes seem to flit in and out of sight, never fully recognizable.  Glowing eyes blink into view every once and a while from the distance.  The surface is upward.  The murky water continues to the east.

rooms.name: In the Murky Moat
rooms.description: The water here is murky and thick with silt.  The surface here seems inaccessible, blocked off by some type of unbreakable sludge.  Large shapes seem to flit in and out of sight never fully recognizable.  Glowing eyes blink into view every once and a while from the distance.  The murky water continues to the east and west.

rooms.name: In the Murky Moat
rooms.description: The water here is murky and thick with silt.  The surface here seems inaccessible, blocked off by some type of unbreakable sludge.  Large shapes seem to flit in and out of sight never fully recognizable.  Glowing eyes blink into view every once and a while from the distance.  The murky water continues to the north and west.

rooms.name: In the Murky Moat
rooms.description: The water here is murky and thick with silt.  The surface here seems inaccessible, blocked off by some type of unbreakable sludge.  Large shapes seem to flit in and out of sight never fully recognizable.  Glowing eyes blink into view every once and a while from the distance.  The murky water continues to the south.

rooms.name: In the Underground pool
rooms.description: You are below the surface of the underground pool.  The water here is remarkably clean and cool.  Very little in the way of weeds or algae grow in here.  The pool seems to be natural.  There appears to be a small dark tunnel in the east wall of the pool.
